title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with some opened, dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file. There is no warning or question message box to give users a chance to save their dirty files before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
SR:
To reproduce: 
1. Start WSWB and create a new project. 
2. Create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. 
3. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. 
4. Left click on the Windows Start menu, select the 'Shut Down...' command to shut down or reboot the computer. 

Expected behavior: 
- Users should receive a warning or question message box asking them to save their dirty files before the computer is shut down or rebooted.
